instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no usb 3
threads.message:
so both of the port,  usb 3 doesnt work ( external hard drive for example ), but there's power as the hard drive is spinning.
usb 2 device like mouse and keyboard work.
charging is fine on both port too.
used known good charging port, same story.

diode mode on usb3 line
<RESISTOR>R3012</RESISTOR> : 0.363, both side
<RESISTOR>R3013</RESISTOR> : 0.363, both side
<CAPACITOR>C3010</CAPACITOR> : 0.700 and O.L
<CAPACITOR>C3011</CAPACITOR> : 0.700 and O.L

any idea ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no usb 3
threads.message:
You should check diode mode on the corresponding lines of J3300.
S-UEM2 is a very useful tool in this case; check it on Aliexpress.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no usb 3
threads.message:
all the diode value is ok, compared to known good board..
maybe <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>/<CHIP>U2900</CHIP> or the <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> itself ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no usb 3
threads.message:
All them are involved in the USB 3 communication.
There is no USB-C redriver chip, like in older models.

Did you test both USB-C ports, in both ways connection?
You have 4 possibilities to connect an USB device to the machine.
